page.title: 07Farming
page.content: Some farms do dairy farming. They have to get up early every morning to milk the cows, so the milk tankers can take it to the dairy to be bottled for us to drink. Some farmers in our area have given up dairy farming this year and have changed to beef and growing crops. The beef farmers have cows to fatten up. Then they take them to market to be sold. They are then killed and the butcher sells the meat. Most farmers here grow crops. A lot of them grow fruit and vegetables, which have to be harvested and sold in the shops. A lot of the fruit farms round here let you go and pick your own - especially strawberries and raspberries. Quite a few people can get jobs picking apples in September. There is one fruit farm that grows blackcurrants to sell to a factory to make a blackcurrant drink.
